column4: Thomas Riddle (1880–1943) was a very wealthy Muggle who owned most of the town of Little Hangleton.
Fleur Isabelle Weasley (née Delacour) (b. c. 1977) was a French, quarter-Veela witch daughter of Apolline Delacour and her husband, and elder sister of Gabrielle.
Mr Crabbe was a wizard, a Death Eater, and the father of Vincent Crabbe.
Argus Filch was a Squib and the caretaker of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry since around 1973.
Fergus (fl.
Scorpius Hyperion Malfoy (b. 2006) was a pure-blood wizard and the son of Draco and Astoria Malfoy (née Greengrass).
Victoire Weasley (b. 2 May, early 2000s) Great Britain was a part-veela witch and the eldest child of Bill and Fleur Weasley (née Delacour).
Isobel McGonagall (née Ross) (fl.
Weasley is the surname of a pure-blood family (though the most recent generation has many non-pureblood members).

Professor Severus Snape (9 January, 1960 – 2 May, 1998) was a half-pure-blood wizard serving as Potions Master (1981-1996), Defence Against the Dark Arts professor (1996-1997), and Headmaster (1997-1998) of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, as well as a member of the Order of the Phoenix and a Death Eater.
Dedalus Diggle (fl.
Dudley Dursley's gang was a group of bullies led by Dudley Dursley.
Mary Riddle (1883–1943) was the wife of Thomas Riddle and mother of Tom Riddle and thus the paternal grandmother of Tom Marvolo Riddle, also known as Lord Voldemort.
Fang (fl.
The Great Hall in the Hogwarts Castle is the main gathering area in the school, which is located off the Entrance Hall.
Peeves was a poltergeist at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, since c. 993.
Arcturus Black O.M. (First Class) (1901 – 1991) was a pure-blood wizard and member of the noble House of Black.
Stonewall High is a state secondary school in the United Kingdom that the Dursley Family had planned for Harry Potter to attend.

Tom Marvolo Riddle (31 December, 1926 – 2 May, 1998), later (and better) known as Lord Voldemort, was a half-blood wizard considered to have been the most powerful and dangerous dark wizard of all time.

column4: The West Country is a region of south-western England, typically defined as including the counties of Cornwall, Devon, Dorset, and Somerset, although Wiltshire, Gloucestershire and Herefordshire are often included.
Owls are birds of prey.
Hugo Granger-Weasley (b. September 2008 or later) was a half-blood wizard and the second child of Ronald Weasley and Hermione Granger.
The Mirror of Erised is a mirror, which, according to Albus Dumbledore, shows the "deepest, most desperate desire of our hearts."
Kendra Dumbledore (c. 1851 – Summer 1899) was a Muggle-bornwitch, the wife of Percival Dumbledore.
Mr Evans (died between 1 September 1971 and 31 October 1981) was a Muggle and the father of Petunia and Lily Evans.
The Killing Curse (Avada Kedavra) is a tool of the Dark Arts and one of the three Unforgivable Curses.
The Trophy Room is a room that moves between the third and sixth-floors of Hogwarts Castle.
Morfin Gaunt (c. 1900 – before 1996) was a pure-blood wizard descended from Salazar Slytherin.
The Elixir of Life is a potion produced by using the Philosopher's Stone that extends the life of the drinker.
Fred Weasley (b. 2000s) was the oldest child of George and Angelina Weasley (née Johnson).
A Hogwarts Express ticket is a ticket provided to all who are attending Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry for the first time.
A vampire is a magical humanoid that is famed for biting people on the neck and sucking their blood.
Percival Dumbledore (fl.
A Galleon or Gold-Galleon () is the most valued coin of the wizarding currency.
Madam Poppy Pomfrey was the matron at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
Cedrella Weasley (née Black) (fl.
Eileen Snape (née Prince) (born c. 1929) was a British witch, wife to the Muggle Tobias Snape and mother to Severus Snape.
Fabian Prewett (d. 1981) was a pure-blood wizard and the brother of both Gideon and Molly.
Grawp (b. post 1931) was a giant that was known, despite standing a full sixteen feet tall, for his small stature and short height.
A Remembrall is a large marble sized glass ball that contains smoke which turns red when its owner has forgotten something.
Gideon Prewett (d. 1981) was a pure-blood wizard, the brother of both Fabian and Molly.
Platform Nine was one of the Muggle railway platforms at King's Cross Station.

Fred Weasley (1 April, 1978 – 2 May, 1998) was a pure-blood wizard, a son of Arthur Weasley and Molly Weasley (née Prewett), brother to Bill, Charlie, Percy, Ron, and Ginny Weasley, and twin brother to George Weasley.
Elphinstone Urquart (d. 1985) was a pure-blood wizard and a Ministry of Magic official for the Department of Magical Law Enforcement in the 1950s.
Broomsticks, also known as brooms, are one of the means employed by wizards and witches to transport themselves between locations.
Irma Black (née Crabbe) (fl.
Hufflepuff is one of the four Houses of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
Albus Severus "Al" Potter (b. c. 2006) was a half-pure-blood wizard, the second son of Harry and Ginevra Potter (née Weasley).
A cannon is a piece of artillery typically used as a weapon, although they are also commonly used for ceremonial purposes.
Harry James Potter (b. 31 July 1980) is a half-pure-blood wizard, and one of the most famous wizards of modern times.

column4: Mrs Ross was a Scottish witch and she and her husband had at least one child, Isobel.
Fridwulfa was a giantess and the mother of the Half-giant Rubeus Hagrid, and the giant Grawp.
A Dark Wizard or Witch is any magical person who primarily studies and/or practises the Dark Arts, otherwise known as Dark Magic.
Mr Ross was a Scottish wizard and he and his wife, a witch, had at least one child, Isobel.
Ignatius Prewett was a pure-blood wizard who married Lucretia Black.
Wizardkind are humans that are born with the ability to perform magic.
Rionach Steward (b. 1600s) was a half-blood American witch and the younger twin daughter of Isolt Sayre and James Steward.
Zombies are "living dead" creatures that dwell in the southern part of the United States of America.
Petunia Dursley (née Evans) (c. 1960 – c. 2020) was a Muggle, the elder daughter of Mr. and Mrs Evans and the sister of the Muggle-born witch Lily.
The Hogwarts uniform is the clothing that students attending Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry are required to wear.
Doris Crockford was a witch who greeted Harry Potter in the Leaky Cauldron on the way to Harry's first trip into Diagon Alley on 31 July 1991.
Rionach Sayre (née Gaunt) (d. 1608) was an Irish pure-blood witch.
Mrs Ollivander was a Muggle-born witch.

George Weasley (b. 1 April, 1978) was a pure-blood wizard, son of Arthur Weasley and Molly Weasley (née Prewett), brother of Bill, Charlie, Percy, Ron, and Ginny, and twin brother of the late Fred Weasley.
The Minister for Magic is the leader of the wizarding community in the United Kingdom and Ireland and the highest ranking member of the Ministry of Magic, which they control.
Garrick Ollivander (b. 25 September, in or prior to 1907) was the proprietor of Ollivanders in Diagon Alley during most of the 20th century.
Defence Against the Dark Arts (sometimes written as DADA) is a subject taught at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry and Ilvermorny School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
Robes are loose-fitting outer garments most commonly worn by wizards and witches.
Kent is a county in south-east England.

Walburga Black (1925 – 1985) was a pure-blood witch, the daughter of Pollux Black and Irma Crabbe, the sister of Alphard and Cygnus, the wife and second cousin of Orion Black and the mother of Sirius III and Regulus II.
The Norwegian Ridgeback is a dragon native to Norway, and its typical habitat is the Northern mountains.
Fluffy was a large, vicious, three-headed dog who was once cared for by Rubeus Hagrid.
Regulus Arcturus Black (1961 – 1979) was a pure-blood wizard, born to Orion and Walburga Black, and the younger brother of Sirius Black.
The Smallest Bedroom is a room located on the upper story of number 4 Privet Drive.

Pollux Black (1912 – 1990) was a pure-blood wizard, the eldest child of Cygnus Black II and Violetta Bulstrode, the brother of Cassiopeia Black, Marius Black, and Dorea Black, the husband of Irma Crabbe, the father of Walburga Black, Alphard Black, and Cygnus Black III, the grandfather of Sirius Black, Regulus Black, Bellatrix Lestrange, Andromeda Tonks, and Narcissa Malfoy, the great-grandfather of Draco Malfoy, Nymphadora Tonks and Delphini, and the great-great-grandfather of Teddy Lupin and Scorpius Malfoy.
Vernon Dursley was a Muggle, husband of Petunia Evans, father of Dudley and uncle of Harry Potter by marriage.
A quill is a writing instrument made from a feather whose tip has been cut into a pointed shape.
Professor Minerva McGonagall, O.M. (First Class), (b. 4 October,1935) was a half-blood witch, the only daughter of Muggle Robert McGonagall and witch Isobel Ross.

column4: Vault 713 is a high security vault at Gringotts Wizarding Bank in London, England.
A Squib, also known as a wizard-born, is a non-magical person who is born to at least one magical parent.

Lily J.Potter (née Evans) (30 January, 1960 – 31 October, 1981) was a Muggle-bornwitch, the younger daughter of Mr and Mrs Evans and the younger sister of Petunia Evans, who would later be the person who would take care of Lily's son.
Reverend Robert McGonagall Senior was a Muggle and Presbyterian minister who lived in Caithness, in Scotland, during the early twentieth century.
Harry Potter's wand was 11" long, made of holly, and possessed a phoenix feather core.
Platform Ten was one of the Muggle railway platforms at King's Cross Station.
Gervaise Ollivander was a wizard who came from a long line of wandmakers who had operated in Diagon Alley since 382 B.C.
Marcus Flint (b. 1974/1975) was a wizard who attended Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry from 1986 to 1994 and was sorted into Slytherin house.
Tobias Snape was a British Muggle and the patriarch of the Snape family in the late twentieth century.
Mrs Arabella Doreen Figg was a Squib, a dealer of cross-bred cats and kneazles, and a member of the Order of the Phoenix.
The Gryffindor Quidditch team is the house Quidditch team of the Hogwarts house Gryffindor.
Marjorie "Marge" EileenDursley was Vernon Dursley's elder sister, sister-in-law to Petunia Dursley, and the aunt of Dudley Dursley.

Draco LuciusMalfoy (b. 5 June, 1980) was a pure-blood wizard and the only son of Lucius and Narcissa Malfoy (née Black).

Potter is the surname of an old wizarding family descended from Ignotus Peverell and Linfred of Stinchcombe.
Mr Longbottom (pre-1947—between 1980 and 1995) was a pure-blood wizard.
Delphini (born c. 1998), known by the nickname Delphi, was a half-pure-blood witch, the daughter of Tom Riddle and Bellatrix Lestrange.
Parchment is a thin material made from calfskin, sheepskin or goatskin, often split.
Gregory Goyle (b. 1979/1980) was a pure-blood wizard in the same year as Harry Potter at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
A ghost is the disembodied spirit of a once-living wizard or witch.
Madam Professor Pomona Sprout (b. 15 May, 1931 or 1941) was a witch who worked as Head of Hufflepuff House and Head of the Herbology department at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

Rufus Fudge was the nephew of former Minister for Magic Cornelius Fudge.
Daphne Greengrass (b. 1979/1980) was a pure-blood witch and a member of the Greengrass family, an old wizarding family and one of the Sacred Twenty-Eight.
The Philosopher's Stone was an artificial, rufescent stone with magical properties.

Lucius Malfoy (b. 1953 - 1954) was a pure-pure-blood wizard, and son of Abraxas Malfoy, husband of Narcissa Black and the father of Draco Malfoy.

Sirius Black (3 November,1959 – 18 June, 1996), also known as Padfoot or Snuffles (in his Animagus form) was a pure-blood wizard, the older son of Orion and Walburga Black, and the brother of Regulus Black.

Ollivanders is a wand shop founded in 382 B.C..
The Hogwarts Library is located off of a corridor on the first-floor of Hogwarts Castle and contains tens of thousands of books on thousands of shelves.
Mrs Fudge was the wife of former Minister for Magic, Cornelius Fudge.
Seamus Finnigan (b. 1979/1980) was a half-pure-blood wizard, son of Muggle Mr Finnigan and Irish witch Mrs Finnigan, something that gave Mr Finnigan a "nasty shock" when he first learned it.

Tessie was a great-aunt of the children of Arthur and Molly Weasley.

Madam Malkin was the owner of Madam Malkin's Robes for All Occasions.

Molly Weasley (b. 2000s) was the elder daughter of Percy and Audrey Weasley.

Griphook was a goblin who worked at Gringotts Wizarding Bank in Diagon Alley.
The Vanishing Spell (Evanesco) is a Transfiguration spell used to vanish both animate and inanimate objects "into non-being, which is to say, everything".
The Levitation Charm (Wingardium Leviosa) is a charm used to make objects fly, or levitate, taught to first years at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
Angelina Weasley (née Johnson) (b. 24 – 30 October, 1977) was a witch and a Gryffindor student at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
Cygnus Black (1938 – 1992) was a pure-blood wizard and member of the noble Black family.
Potions is a core class and subject taught at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry and Ilvermorny School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
A giant is a very large humanoid which can potentially grow to approximately twenty five feet tall and appear to be a large human.
Alphard Black (between 1925 and 1938 — 1976/1977) was a pure-blood wizard from the noble Black family and was a Slytherin student at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

column2: Madam Malkin's Robes for All Occasions
column4: Madam Malkin's Robes for All Occasions, also known as Madam Malkin's Robes or simply Madam Malkin's, was a shop in North Side, Diagon Alley.

column4: Rodolphus Lestrange was a pure-blood wizard, brother of Rabastan, possibly the son of Lestrange and a Slytherin student at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
Frank Longbottom was a pure-blood wizard, an Auror for the Ministry of Magic during Lord Voldemort's first rise to power.
Lee Jordan (b. 1977/1978) was a wizard, son of Mr and Mrs Jordan, and a Gryffindor student at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry from 1989 to 1996 (a couple of years before Harry).
Mrs Wood was the mother of Oliver Wood.
James Leigh Hamilton (b. 17 November, 1982) is a professional rugby union player who plays as a lock for the Scottish rugby team since 2006.

Mrs Goyle was the wife of Mr Goyle and the mother of Gregory Goyle, a student at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
The Forbidden Forest, also known as Dark Forest borders the edges of the Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry grounds.
A Mine Cart is used to transport customers between the vaults of Gringotts Wizarding Bank.
A charm is a spell that adds certain properties to an object or creature.

Narcissa Malfoy (née Black), (b. 1955) was a pure-pure-blood witch, the youngest daughter of Cygnus Black III and Druella Rosier, younger sister of Bellatrix Lestrange and Andromeda Tonks, wife of Lucius Malfoy, mother of Draco Malfoy and the grandmother of Scorpius Malfoy.

Professor Firenze was a centaur, part of the Forbidden Forest Centaur colony, and a Divination teacher at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry from 1996-1998.
Percy Ignatius Weasley (b. 22 August, 1976) was a pure-blood wizard, the third child of Arthur and Molly Weasley (née Prewett).
Dudley Dursley (b. 23 June, 1980) was the Muggle son of Vernon and Petunia Dursley and cousin of Harry Potter.

Geraint Ollivander was a great wandmaker who lived in the Middle Ages.
Gormlaith Gaunt (c. 1576 – 1643) was an Irish pure-blood witch.
King's Cross Station is considered one of the main train stations to serve London, England.

A Headmaster or Headmistress is the chief administrator of a School of Magic.
The Ministry of Magic (M.o.M.) is the main governing body of the magical community of Great Britain (i.e. England, Scotland and Wales) and Ireland with the intention of preservation of magical law.
Minerva was a powerful witch.

Charles"Charlie" Weasley (b. 12 December, 1972) was the second eldest son of Arthur and Molly Weasley (née Prewett), younger brother of Bill Weasley and the elder brother of Percy, George, Ron, Ginny Weasley, and the late Fred Weasley.
Corvinus Gaunt (fl.
Martha Steward was a Muggle.
M. G. McGonagall was a Gryffindor student at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry in the early 1970s.
Minister Hermione Jean Granger (b. 19 September, 1979) was a Muggle-bornwitch born to Mr and Mrs Granger, both dentists.
Honoria was the spinster aunt of Albus Dumbledore.
Surrey is a county in the South East of England, and one of the home counties.
The Dursley family is a Muggle family, and the only known living close relatives of Harry Potter.

Andromeda Tonks (née Black) (b. 1951-1955), also known as Dromeda, was a pure-blood witch and the middle daughter of Cygnus and Druella Black (née Rosier), as well as the sister of Bellatrix and Narcissa.
Mrs Granger (temporarily known as Monica Wilkins) was a Muggle, the wife of Mr Granger, and mother of Hermione Jean Granger.
Mr Granger (temporarily known as Wendell Wilkins) was a Muggle, the husband of Mrs Granger, and father of Hermione Jean Granger.

Bertie Bott's Every Flavour Beans are one of the most popular sweets in the wizarding world.
Arthur Weasley (b. 6 February, 1950) was a pure-pure-blood wizard in the employ of the Ministry of Magic, as well as a member of the second Order of the Phoenix.
A wand is a quasi-sentient magical instrument through which a witch or wizard channels her or his magical powers to centralise the effects for more complex results.
The Hogwarts Express is the name of the train that makes a run between London, King's Cross Station Platform 9¾ and Hogsmeade Station.
The Cloak of Invisibility is a magical artefact used to render the wearer invisible, and one of the fabled Deathly Hallows.

Chocolate Frogs are a popular confection that are sold throughout the wizarding world.
Ronald Bilius "Ron" Weasley (b. 1 March, 1980) was a pure-pure-blood wizard, the sixth and youngest son of Arthur and Molly Weasley (née Prewett).
Edward "Ted" Tonks (d. March, 1998) was a Muggle-born wizard, the husband of Andromeda Tonks (née Black), the father of Nymphadora Tonks, and grandfather of Edward Remus Lupin.

Bellatrix Lestrange (née Black) (1951 – 2 May, 1998) was a pure-blood witch, the eldest daughter of Cygnus Black III and Druella Black (née Rosier) and elder sister of Andromeda Tonks and Narcissa Malfoy.
The Fat Lady was a portrait, who guarded the entrance to Gryffindor Tower at Hogwarts Castle.
Professor Neville Longbottom (b. 30 July, 1980) was a pure-pure-blood wizard, and one of the most famous wizards of modern times.
Tom Riddle's wand was 13½" long and belonged to Tom Riddle, the wizard who later became known as Lord Voldemort.
Hedwig (d. 27 July, 1997) was Harry Potter's pet Snowy Owl (Bubo scandiacus).
Professor Albus Percival Wulfric Brian Dumbledore, , , , ,  (c. Summer1881 – 30 June, 1997) was the Transfiguration Professor, and later Headmaster of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

Godric's Hollow is a village in the West Country of England.
Devil's Snare is a plant with the magical ability to constrict or strangle anything in its surrounding environment or something that happens to touch it.
Alice Longbottom was a pure-blood witch, an Auror who worked for the Ministry of Magic during Lord Voldemort's first rise to power.
Romania (Romanian: România) is a country located in southeastern Europe.
Callidora Longbottom (née Black) (b. 1915) was a pure-blood witch, the eldest daughter of Arcturus Black II and Lysandra Yaxley and sister of Charis and Cedrella.
Rubeus Hagrid's father (died c. 1941) was a wizard and the first husband of Fridwulfa.

The Deluminator, also known as the Put-Outer, is a device used by Albus Dumbledore (the first known owner and designer of the one Deluminator known to exist) to remove light sources from the Deluminator's immediate surroundings, as well as bestow them.
The Hospital Wing is a part of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
Merope Riddle (née Gaunt) (c. 1907 – 31 December, 1926) was a pure-pure-blood witch, daughter of Marvolo Gaunt, and sister of Morfin.
A prefect at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry is a student who has been given extra authority and responsibilities by the Head of House and Headmaster.
William Topaz McGonagall (c. 1825—29 September, 1902) was a Scottish Muggle celebrated as the worst poet in British history.
Slytherin is one of the four Houses at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, founded by Salazar Slytherin.
Melania Black (née Macmillan) (fl.
Dominique Weasley (b. 2000s) was a part-veela witch and the second daughter of Bill and Fleur Weasley (née Delacour).
Mrs Dursley was the wife of Dudley Dursley: the couple had twochildren.
Marvolo Gaunt (c. 1879 – between 1925 & 1929) was a pure-blood wizard of the House of Gaunt and descendant of Salazar Slytherin.
History of Magic is a core class and subject taught at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
Dragons are giant winged, fire-breathing reptilian Creatures.
Goblins are a highly intelligent race of small humanoids with long fingers and feet that coexist with the wizard world.
Transfiguration is a core class and subject taught at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
Orion Black (1929 – 1979) was a pure-blood wizard and the eldest son of Arcturus Black III and Melania Macmillan.
A Weasley jumper is a home-made jumper made by Molly Weasley for family and friends and sent as Christmas gifts.
Astoria Malfoy (née Greengrass) (c. 1982 – 2019) was a pure-blood witch.
James SiriusPotter (b. c. 2004) was a half-pure-blood wizard, the eldest child of Harry and Ginevra Potter (née Weasley).
The Golden Snitch, often called simply the Snitch, is the third and smallest ball used in Quidditch.

Ronan was a centaur who lived in the Forbidden Forest, and was distrustful of humans, although he tried to protect Harry Potter and Hermione Granger from the other centaurs in 1996, pointing out that they were "foals".
A Troll is a magical creature of prodigious strength and immense stupidity.
Rose "Rosie" Granger-Weasley (b. 2005/2006) was a half-blood witch and the daughter of Ronald Weasley and Hermione Granger.
Tom Riddle Senior (1905 – 1943) was an affluent Muggle who lived in the village of Little Hangleton.
Dragon hide is used to make clothing.
The Hogwarts letter is a letter of acceptance to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry sent to British wizards and witches prior to their first year at Hogwarts.
The Sorting Hat is a sentient hat at Hogwarts that magically determines which of the four school Houses each new student belongs most to.
Madam Rolanda Hooch (b. before 1918) was a witch who worked as the Flying instructor, Quidditch referee and coach at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry during, at least, the 1990s.
Mrs Norris is the pet cat of Argus Filch, the caretaker of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
Norberta, originally Norbert, (b. Spring 1992) was a Norwegian Ridgeback Dragon hatched by Rubeus Hagrid in his hut at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
Sirius Black's motorbike was a motorcycle owned by Sirius Black.
Professor Phineas Nigellus Black (1847 – 1925) was a pure-blood wizard, possibly the son of Cygnus and Ella Black, and brother of Sirius, Elladora and Iola Black.
Malcolm McGonagall was the second child and first son of Muggle Robert McGonagall and witch Isobel Ross.

Perenelle Flamel (before 1334 - between 1992 and 1996) Perenelle and her husband drank the Elixir of Life produced by the stone, and were immortal, until the stone was destroyed in 1992, after which she and Nicolas would later die.
Mrs Finnigan (fl.
Diagon Alley is a cobblestoned wizarding alley and shopping area located in London, England behind a pub called the Leaky Cauldron.
Mr Finnigan was an Irish Muggle and the father of Seamus Finnigan.
Minister Josephina Flint was Minister for Magic from 1819 to 1827.
Roxanne Weasley (b. 2000s) is the daughter of George Weasley and Angelina Weasley (née Johnson).
Lucretia Prewett (née Black) (1925 – 1992) was a pure-blood witch from the pureblooded Black family who was married into the Prewett family.
The Leaky Cauldron was a popular wizarding pub and inn located in London.
Audrey Weasley (maiden name unknown) was the wife of Percy Weasley.
There was a zoo in Surrey, where the Dursleys took Dudley on his eleventh birthday, along with Piers Polkiss and, against their will, Harry.
Grunnings was a drill-making company in Surrey, England.
Salazar Slytherin (fl.
Augusta Longbottom (b. pre 1947) was a pure-blood witch and member of the Longbottom family through marriage.
Enid Longbottom (fl.
Nymphadora Lupin (née Tonks) (c. 1973 – 2 May, 1998) more commonly known as Tonks, occasionally Dora, was a half-blood witch and the only child of Ted and Andromeda Tonks (née Black).
4 Privet Drive was the street address of the home owned by Vernon and Petunia Dursley.
In early November 1981, a number of celebrations were held by wizards to celebrate what they believed to be the fall of the Dark Wizard Lord Voldemort.
Greengrass is the surname of a pure-blood wizarding family, and one of the Sacred Twenty-Eight.
Muggle (Britain) and No-Maj (United States, pl.
Oliver Wood (born c.1975 or 1976) was a Scottish wizard who was the Keeper and Captain for the Gryffindor Quidditch team.
Hannah Abbott (b. 1979/1980) was a half-pure-blood witch and a member of the Abbott family.
Bane was a centaur living as part of the Forbidden Forest Centaur colony.
The Daily Prophet is a wizarding newspaper based in London.
Septimus Weasley was a pure-blood wizard who married Cedrella Black.
Tawny Owl (binomial name Strix aluco) is a stocky, medium-sized owl commonly found in woodlands across much of Eurasia.
Ravenclaw is one of the four Houses of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, founded by Rowena Ravenclaw.

GinevraMolly"Ginny" Potter (neé Weasley) (b. 11 August, 1981), occasionally known as Gin, was a pure-pure-blood witch, the youngest of Arthur and Molly Weasley's (née Prewett) seven children, and the first female to be born into the Weasley line for several generations.
The Cupboard Under the Stairs was Harry Potter's room in the Dursley household until he was given Dudley Dursley's old room, at 4 Privet Drive in Little Whinging, Surrey.

column4: Robert McGonagall Jr was the youngest child and second son of Muggle Robert McGonagall Snr and witch Isobel Ross.
Bilius (surname Weasley or Prewett) was a pure-blood wizard and a brother of either Arthur Weasley or Molly Weasley née Prewett.
Ariana Dumbledore (c. 1885 – summer 1899) was a half-blood witch and the youngest child and only daughter of Percival and Kendra Dumbledore.
Quirinus Quirrell claimed to have received his turban from an African prince in return for ridding him of a zombie.
The Nimbus 2000 was produced by the Nimbus Racing Broom Company as part of their successful line of racing brooms.
A harp is a stringed musical instrument with the plane of its strings positioned perpendicular to the soundboard.
